Description: Alabaster bottle with two handles and three feet.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: There are no exact parallels for this form among stone vessels from Amathus or other Cypriot sites, though individual parts (lip, neck and body) can be compared to examples from the late CA period down to Roman times (see Chavane 1990, 77-82 for a survey and general comments based on the finds from Amathus, with further refs to material found outside of Cyprus). The range of material in the tomb, which seems to have been used over several periods, appears to confirm this, though Hell. to Roman finds predominate. Bibliography: Chavane M.-J. 1990, La nécropole d'Amathonte. Tombs 110-385. IV. Les petits objets (Nicosia).
